00027 //

00034 typedef struct REGION
00035 {
00036    double start, end;
00037    
00038    //used for sorting
00039    static int cmp( REGION **a, REGION **b )
00040    { 
00041       return ( ( *a )->start < ( *b )->start ) ? -1 : 1; 
00042    }
00043 }Region;
00044 WX_DEFINE_ARRAY( Region*, Regions );

00075    struct Location {
00076       // Position of track location
00077       double pos;
00078       
00079       // Type of track location
00080       LocationType typ;
00081       
00082       // Only for typ==locationMergePoint

00255    // Get access to the clips in the tracks. This is used by

00258    WaveClipList::compatibility_iterator GetClipIterator() { return mClips.GetFirst(); }

00271    // Get the nth clip in this WaveTrack (will return NULL if not found).
00272    // Use this only in special cases (like getting the linked clip), because
00273    // it is much slower than GetClipIterator().
00274    WaveClip* GetClipByIndex(int index);

00279    // Add all wave clips to the given array 'clips' and sort the array by
00280    // clip start time. The array is emptied prior to adding the clips.
00281    void FillSortedClipArray(WaveClipArray& clips);
00282 
00283    // Before calling 'Offset' on a clip, use this function to see if the
00284    // offsetting is allowed with respect to the other clips in this track.
00285    // This function can optionally return the amount that is allowed for offsetting
00286    // in this direction maximally.
00287    bool CanOffsetClip(WaveClip* clip, double amount, double *allowedAmount=NULL);
00288 
00289    // Before moving a clip into a track (or inserting a clip), use this 
00290    // function to see if the times are valid (i.e. don't overlap with
00291    // existing clips).
00292    bool CanInsertClip(WaveClip* clip);
00293 
00294    // Move a clip into a new track. This will remove the clip
00295    // in this cliplist and add it to the cliplist of the
00296    // other clip. No fancy additional stuff is done.
00297    void MoveClipToTrack(int clipIndex, WaveTrack* dest);
00298    void MoveClipToTrack(WaveClip *clip, WaveTrack* dest);
00299    
00300    // Remove the clip from the track and return a pointer to it.
00301    WaveClip* RemoveAndReturnClip(WaveClip* clip);
00302    
00303    // Append a clip to the track
00304    void AddClip(WaveClip* clip);
00305    
00306    // Merge two clips, that is append data from clip2 to clip1,
00307    // then remove clip2 from track.
00308    // clipidx1 and clipidx2 are indices into the clip list.
00309    bool MergeClips(int clipidx1, int clipidx2);
00310 
00311    // Cache special locations (e.g. cut lines) for later speedy access
00312    void UpdateLocationsCache();
00313 
00314    // Get number of cached locations
00315    int GetNumCachedLocations() { return mDisplayNumLocations; }
00316    Location GetCachedLocation(int index) { return mDisplayLocations[index]; }
00317 
00318    // Expand cut line (that is, re-insert audio, then delete audio saved in cut line)
00319    bool ExpandCutLine(double cutLinePosition, double* cutlineStart = NULL, double* cutlineEnd = NULL);
00320 
00321    // Remove cut line, without expanding the audio in it
00322    bool RemoveCutLine(double cutLinePosition);
00323 
00324    // This track has been merged into a stereo track.  Copy shared parameters
00325    // from the new partner.
00326    virtual void Merge(const Track &orig);
00327
